Just as you think you made a connection with the poor girl you hear your name called from the living room. You look down at the girl and tell her, "I'll be right back okay?"

As you start to move away from her she yells to you, "My name's Jess."

You smile at the fact that she trusted you with her name. You smile and lean over and say, "My name's Jake nice to meet you." yousay as you picked yourself up and went to your parents. Your mom was 37 years old and your dad was 38. Your mom and a beautiful face that made her look so much younger. As for your dad he was a well built guy that could take anyone down if needed. He was once a street fighter but now his a cop. People said you looked like your mom but the body of your dad. You laugh at them but you say thanks. "So how was your day at school?" is what your dad said. You hate when they make small talk cause then you knew they were just talking about you.

You think to yourself for a moment and say, "Same as any other day. I ran into someone on the way home and had a nice little chat with them." You smile at yourself because that is all true and you don't need to lie about anything.

"Who was it?" your mom asked.

"A girl that lives a couple a blocks from us named Jess."

Your parents let you leave because you had very little friends. Though with you sitting down made her bounce twice as high as before. You take your hands and grab her in midair. She turns around in your hand and stares at you with her dark blue eyes. You now take this time to notice how she looks. She has red hair that goes past her shoulders, Beautiful blue eyes, a small but noticeable nose, a smile that makes you very happy to see on her face.

You also start to stare that he rest when she says, "Are you picturing me naked?" She giggles and it causes you to blush. This tiny girl made a giant like you to blush. You chuckled to yourself about that.

"Maybe I am you don't know though do you," you tease her knowing that you don't even need to imagine her naked but you could force her if you wanted to.

"Why were you guys...."

While making the clothes you continued to talk to her about the different classes that you went to, every so often stopping to see if she understood what was being said or if she had a question about a certain topic. It was easier than you thought it would have been since she absorbed every word you said like a sponge. Once a couple of outfits were made you tell her to try them on. Setting them down beside her you smile a little sheepishly, "Sorry if they're not the best in the world."

Jess couldn't help but giggle at your statement. She had not had a decent pair of clothes in her entire life, so to her, these were the best clothes in the world. Turning she picked up the clothes and carried them into the house. Stripping down she walked over to the mirror that was on her small table and frowned, wishing she had a better body that wasn't covered in scars. Shaking her head she blushed, "Wh..why am I thinking that." Without further delay, she turned and put on the first set of clothing which was a simple pair of jeans and a T shirt. Walking back out the door she looked up at you and smiled.

You had meanwhile been busying yourself with preparing the story on what to tell the teacher's at school on Monday. Looking over you saw Jess step outside in her new outfit and nodded, "It looks very good on you Jess. Does it fit alright?"

Jess nodded, "I-it's fine, although its a... little umm.." she squirmed a bit not wanting to sound ungrateful, finishing meekly, "itchy around the..... c-crotch" She blushed a bright crimson looking down quickly.

You felt yourself getting a little red out of awkwardness, and a bit embarassment, "Oh I'm sorry. I didn't even.... I mean I should've.... er..." Scratching your head he leaned close asking, "Umm... do you have panties on?" You kept your voice at a whisper looking around as though you didn't want anyone eavesdropping to overhear.

Jess blushed and shook her head, "I.. I don't have any...." She hadn't had any need for them in her past home so there was no reason for her to have them. Looking up at you she asks, "Can you make me some like you made these clothes.... *yawn*.....oh i'm sorry."

Looking at the time you smile and shake your head. Maybe in the morning, but right now I think that we need to get some sleep. 1113311111.title: She falls asleep

11133111111.content:
“Can I sleep with you?” Jess asked form her room.

“Are you sure? I mean I don’t roll over in my sleep but still,” you say a little concerned.

“I’ll be fine.”

“Alright but you might want to put these on,” you give her pajamas. “These are what you wear when you sleep.” Jess nodded and took the pajamas. You closed the roof to give her some privacy. When she came out of the door she yawned again and walked onto your hand. “You know if I’m supposed to be watching you then that means I should take your room and put it in mine uh?” you ask, using your other hand to grab the little house you made and started to walk into your room. You put her room down on top of your headboard. “I guess you can sleep on the pillow for safety.” You don’t get a respond; looking over in your hand she’s fast asleep. “I’ll take that as a yes.” Putting her on the pillow you rest your head right next to her, lie down, and go to sleep.

When you wake up you feel something pulling your ear. Opening your eyes you see Jess standing on you cheek. With a quick snatch you get her off your cheek. “What are you doing,” you ask half asleep.

“Waking you up, sleepy head!” Jess says cheerfully.

“Uh what time is it?” looking at your clock it says, 5:02 am. “What are you up so early?” you ask.

“This is the time I usually wake up at. Yesterday though, I woke up at two just to escape my little brother’s cage,” Jess looks down at the ground.

“Hey, you don’t need to worry about that stuff anymore, but I need to ask you to not wake up this early on the weekends. It’s the only time of the week not to wake up at five.”

“Okay, but now your awake, what do you want to do?”

“Sleep.”

“No way, I tried too hard to wake you up, your now staying awake!” Jess yelled into your ear.

“Fine, I’ll stay awake. Now what to do? I guess I can make your underwear and show you a few things you’ll need to know about school.” She jumped in joy when you said that. First thirty minutes were spent on making her some underwear and bras. Once she puts them away you start telling her a few thing things she’ll need to be ready for school. You tell her about knowing math, which it turns out she spied on her brother as he did his math and he was two years younger than her. “Okay that makes this easier; all I need to show you is a few things.” You ask her to do some old problems that you could remember and she is just picking these things up and is doing them like she’s always been able to.

“How is that?” Jess asked as you gave her one of your resent homework assignment. Looking at your answer she got it right.

“Damn you’re good,” is all you can say. “I’ll give you some of my other work.” When you give her the assignments she does the English okay. Not the best, writer, but so would you if you had to write with a pencil that’s the same size as you, or type on a keyboard that’s the size of a cat walk to you. She was horrible at Spanish, and she was great at biology. “So you’re good at Math, Science, and History. Okay in English, and is bad in Spanish and Gym.”

“Hey, no I’m not,” Jess said as she sat down.

“Okay then run a mile in eight minutes.” She went quite which made you laugh. “It’s okay I’m sure there’ll be some things for you to do at your size, like pull ups.” You say holding out your pencil above her head, laughing at your own joke.

“Very funny Mr. Giant,” she says as she gives you a dirty look. “So where are your mom and dad?”

“They came home last night. They have to work in the morning, tomorrow mom’s off and Monday dad is. What time is it?” Looking at your alarm its 12:13 pm. “Well that took longer than expected, hunger?”

“Yes I am what is there to eat?”

“Apples, turkey, tuna…”

“What’s tuna?”

“It’s a fish that’s really good when you make it the right way. Want to try some?”

“Sure.”

111331111111.content:
Making the tuna was the easy part. Explaining where the tuna came from and the whole idea of the ocean to Jess was hard. It was the whole, what else live in the ocean, how big is it deal.

“So there’s still so much about the ocean we don’t know because we as humans can breathe underwater. We have made machines known as submarines but they can only stay under for so long,” you say, “Now let’s eat, I’m hungry.”

“Okay but it’s strange, we haven’t even explored half of our own world yet,” Jess took a handful of tuna and tried it. “Mmmmmm it’s good, I could eat this all day.”

“Bad idea, if you eat too much tuna you’ll get mercury poisoning. Eating one a day, for a week is a good idea, part of the reason why tuna is so good.”

“But if it can kill you why eat?”

“Because it’s also health too, that’s where a famous saying, “Too much of a good thing can be bad.” That means if it’s good, too much of it will hurt you sooner or later.”

“Okay. Strange, there’s so much to this world that we don’t understand.” Jess said as she ate some more.

“I could tell you some more interesting things, but I have a bad feeling you’ll be confused,” you say out loud.

“What?”

“Oh, nothing just another part of history, is mythology. It’s the study of things that people used to believe in but not into days world. The best example would be dragons.”

“What’s a dragon?”

“That’s a funny thing to ask. A dragon is a “beast” that in all cultures are known to being large, scaly creatures that can fly, and breathe fire. Though different cultures have different ideas of what their dragons do, everyone in the world did believe in dragons before they thought of there being other human being around the world.”

“How long ago was that?” Jess asked sitting there in astonishment.

“A long time ago, I think the first idea of dragons was from when man was starting to evolve into who we are today, so about a few hundred thousand years ago.”

“Wow, that’s strange. Why would we believe in something like that if there never was any?”

“The truth is, Jess, which a lot of the stories of dragons had most killed. Dragons might have been real, but some believe that mankind made them go dye out as a species. In today’s world a lot of more modern day stories are about the idea of meeting a dragon, or life would have been like to live with them.”

“Wow, that’s cool. Can you show me some?”

“Sure but let’s finish eating.” That’s where you thought of something, “My dad should have been home about an hour ago. I wonder where he is.”

“Maybe his work is keeping him?”

“Or knowing him and my mom, they’re both trying to get some more information about your birth. Dad might arrest your parents, if there is a birth certificate saying you are a human being.”

“But I thought I was already?”

“You are it’s just that if you have a birth certificate it says you are who you are, that you were born in a certain place, and that you exist. Without one, you might have a lot of problems ahead.”

“Where could they find my birth certificate?”

“I’m not sure,” is all you can say. You finish the rest of her side of the tuna sandwich. She jumps off the plate so you can put it way. “Now let’s find us story about a dragon,” you try and brighten the mood you set.

“Sure, don’t you have any books about them?”

“We have some books called Eragon, but I know a website that has a lot of good stories about dragons. Some in fact let you see their point of view.” You go onto the computer and pull up Writing.com, you go to your favorites bar and find Outcast. For the next couple of minutes you two were stuck on the first page because you had to explain to her about the computer, but when you finish explaining it, you both sat down and enjoyed the story Bruce Lee Gifford Jr. made.

1113311111112.content:
You and Jess are about five chapters deep in Outcast when you hear the door open. Looking over to the door you find your Mom walking in with another doctor and a suitcase.

“Hey Mom, who’s this?”

“This is Dr. Roy Gilmore. He was in charge of Jess’s doctor that watched over her. He works at the in the genetics. Roy has her records and her birth certificate, but before he will let us see it, he wished to see Jess and hear what has happened after she left the hospital.”

“Nice to see you again Roy,” Jess said waving to him.

“Nice to see you too, from what Tina told me I would take it you don’t remember what happened since you were four,” Dr. Roy said.

“The first thing I remember is leaving the hospital and you waving bye to me,” Jess said sitting down on the computer desk.

“Well from what Tina told me is that they abused you, I’m sorry,” Dr. Roy said getting to eye level with her.

You look at your mom, “I guess you plan on suing her parents for child abuse uh?”

“Yes, we need Dr. Roy to give us her birth certificate. He is the only one with access to it, because he helped give birth to her. Don’t ask how they know, or how that worked.”

“Won’t, but does this mean his going to take care of her?” you asked.

“No son,” Dr. Roy said, “I have a family on my own and if I had Jess stay with us, she would most likely be my baby daughters’ chew toys.”

“I remember when my little brother did that to me, ugh,” Jess shuttered. Jess then started to tell Dr. Roy. This time, she didn’t cry, but she looked like she was about to at some points.

“I’m so sorry for letting them take you like that. I thought that once you grew up in a hospital, and try and adapt to regular sized people you’d have a “normal” life. But hearing that the moment you left you were used as your mother’s vibrator, uh,” was Dr. Roy could say. “Three weeks after you left they said you were dead, but I just kept your birth certificate in case we had another like you, then I would have someone to help reference to.”

“So they said I was dead just so I wouldn’t have to keep being asked about me? I don’t ever want to return to them, is there away so I don’t?”

“Well sweetie, that’s what we’re doing,” your mom said, “If we sue your parents for child abuse, and with all this to back it up, you won’t have to return to them. They lose custody of you, and if we fill out the custody forms, you can live with us. Jake will help you with any problem, and if he can’t take care of it, then come to us.”

Jess started to get teary eyed, “Thank you.”

Dr. Roy then opened his suit case and pulled out Jess’s birth certificate, looking at where the feet print were all you saw where two dots. “Here you go Tina, I wish you all luck in the case, and know I’ll help out any way I can.”

“Thank you Dr. Roy.” And with that Dr. Roy left, looking back at Jess she was looking at her birth certificate, and chuckled a little.

“Wow, those used to be my feet, their so small,” Jess laughed.

“To us, your baby feet look like dots,” you say putting one finger on her back.

“Do you really think they even want custody over me?” Jess said both you and your mom looked down at her.

“What do you mean?”

“I’ve been gone a day now, and after everything they’ve done to me, I don’t think they even know I left. I just think, that maybe they think I’m dead, so we might not need to sue them.”

“We could do that Jess, but what would happen if they find you with us?” your mom asked. “They would try and sue us for kidnapping. The fact that they live on the street means that sooner or later they’ll see you. The only legal way to keep you is through a custody battle. With your birth certificate we should be able to get the jury to know you’re human too. If we can, we win; if we don’t then … we’ll see what happens.”

“Don’t worry about Jess,” you say, “No matter what happens you’re always welcome here.”

“Thanks, but when will this whole thing happen?”

“Tomorrow, hopefully it won’t take long,” your mom said.

“Is dad trying to get a case for her on his break?” you ask.

“Yeah, he called me saying he got her case, that’s how I know it’s for tomorrow.”

“Alright, you want some tuna mom?” “Just made,” You and Jess taunted.

“Sure, but I’ll have to have it to go,” your mom said. You know she might so you had one premade ready in the fridge. You hand it to her and she was off.

“How can you deal with them being out all the time?” Jess asked once the door closed.

“Just one of the things you get used to. They’ve been working since I was born. I do some things my parents might not like, but it’s nothing to worry about.”

“Like what?”

“I like to draw and work on some computers, so I have a little business that people come to me to fix some of their computers or want a drawing of something and I do it for a price. I’m not legal age to work, but I do it more as a hobby.”

“Why is it not legal?”

“Well I don’t have the right papers to say I can do it, I’m not old enough to own a real business, and then the fact that most of the kids ask me to fix their parents computers without them knowing. Business is a little slow but here and there I get some customers,” you say, but there is another thing you do for cash that you didn’t dare, tell anyone.

“Okay, what’s wrong with some of them?” Jess was full of questions, far too easy to tell.

“Normally something that they did, spilled soda on it, downloaded the “wrong” thing, the things that most kids do on their parents’ computer,” you think of what you usually have to do.

“Alright, but what do you do on your parents’ computer?”

“Well that’s funny; you think I would do something like that? I really just use the computer to download some of the art I do, and some of jobs I do. Some people email me about some problems and I tell them what to do. Other than that, I usually draw.”
1113311111112.title: Jess's doctor

choices: "I was thinking about how adorable you are." (Open up a bit)
"I was thinking about which movie to pick." (Change the subject)
11133111111122.content:
Your Dad was able to seek the counseling of one of the most successful Child Custody Lawyers in the county, Jack Downey. Jess's case intrigued him, for obvious reasons, but Jack insisted on having a sit-down with the family before they officially took this case to court. A dinner date with Jack and Dr. Roy was set up for the following Friday night.

...............................

You were never really popular at school, but you still managed to find yourself a few acquaintances (even though you always seemed to be a "fifth-wheel" type person). In group conversations you'd occasionally throw in a joke or a witty comment of sorts and get a quick laugh, but you'd fade into the background just as quickly. School itself was a breeze, you being a genius and all that, but those 6 hours away from home could feel pretty damn lonely at times. The only person who you would consider to be your friend was this sophomore guy, Jordan Michaels. He towered over you and most other people at 6'7 and, of course, played basketball. He was a member of the FCA (Fellowship of Christian Athletes), a leader at his youth group, and one of the nicest guys at the school. He was the type of guy who would smile politely after a stranger made a "Jordan Michaels = Michael Jordan" joke for the billionth time and even though he often invited you to youth group and church events he never seemed preachy or overly-aggressive in sharing his religion.

In the week leading up to the dinner with Jack and Dr. Roy, you felt even more isolated than usual. Even though it was the middle of May (about 5 or 6 months away from basketball season), Jordan got talked into doing off-season workouts.

"I've got some college scouts looking at me now," he explained, "I need to keep getting better."

That was fine with you though; with Jess waiting for you at home, you had no interest in hanging out with anyone else. Every day you were welcomed by Jess in the same way that you imagine a dog would greet their owner. On Wednesday, in fact, she actually perched up on a shelf next to the front door and pounced onto your neck as you walked in. Over the next couple of months she would relentlessly tease you for the "girlish shriek" that you let out.

Before you went back to school on Monday, you showed her how to type on the computer (for someone who had never been to school before, she learned to write/type fairly quickly) and enter things into Google. Every afternoon she would have thousands of questions, mostly having to do with books, music, and movies. You would do the best you could to fill her in on what she missed pop-culturally the first 15 years of her life. You would think that a task like that would be draining on you, but something about her raw enthusiasm for learning about these things gave you the desire to teach them. She learned about everything from Peter Pan and Grim's Fairy Tales to YouTube and Vine in the afternoon and all the "boring stuff" as you did your homework. The concept of homework seemed to baffled her and throw a wet towel on her perception of school.

"You mean they teach this boring crap to you all day and then they make you do more of it when you get home?"

"You're preaching to the choir," you told her as you finally finished off your 15th math problem.

.............................................................

On Friday, Jess greeted you at the door and demanded that you watch a movie.

"I've learned so much about books and music, but I've never seen a movie before."

"Wow," you mutter under your breath, trying to wrap your head around that fact. "Yeah, we've got a few hours before dinner. We can totally do that."

You get a giant bowl of popcorn for the two of you (mostly just you), grab a Coke and pour some of it into a shot glass for Jess to sip on (ignore the fact that your family has shot glasses. They totally don't have a drinking problem). You open up Netflix on your laptop and and set up everything in the living room. You lay down on the couch with the laptop on your lap and Jess sitting criss-cross on your chest with her body facing the massive computer screen.

"What do you want to watch?" you ask.

"Something good, I guess?" she said, "I don't know, I've never watched any movies before."

"That is so weird," you mutter.

"I knooooooooowww," she said, curling into a ball; visibly embarrassed, but still playful, "I'm so weird."

"Hey," you reply, "Don't worry, I've got you covered."

She turned around and grinned at you. It always stuck you as strange that someone who had been used as a human sex toy in her previous home could ever be as comfortable around normal sized people as she was. Over the past week, she never screamed when you picked her up, she insisted on sleeping next to you every night, and she even started to open up to you about her past a little bit. It reminded you a bit of a quote from that book you were forced to read this year, The Great Gatsby, "...she blossomed for him like a flower." You feel almost like she's yours, not as if you took her by force and own her but as if she simply decided to completely trust you with her life. These were all weird things to notice while you were simply getting ready to watch a movie with her, but you are just now noticing these feelings of... intimacy you feel for her. You think that you might actually love her.

"...Hello?" Jess was saying, standing up and waving her hands in front of your face as you snap out of your trance, "You still there, Jake?"

Completely embarrassed, you turn your attention toward the computer screen and type "Star Wars" into the Netflix search bar as you try to ignore Jess's hysterical laughter.

"Oh man," she gasped between breaths and laughter, "You were really gone there. You were just staring into space for a solid 45 seconds."

"Yeah, I guess I did space out pretty hard there."

"What were you thinking about?"

"Oh nothing."

"Oh come on," she said, stretching her body out, laying on her stomach and army-crawling up toward your face, "Tell me."

Could you stop being so damn cute?, you think to myself. If I tell her the truth, that could make things weird between us. On the other hand, what would she do about it? It's not like she could leave, she needs me. Then you scold yourself for thinking like that. That's not far off from how her old family used to think.

When you looked back down at her, she had her head resting on her folded arms with her eyebrows raised and a half smile on her face.

"I'm waiting."

Do you open up to her a bit or do you misdirect the conversation?
11133111111122.title: 5 Days Of Jess

111331111111221.content:
She initially appears to be totally taken off-guard by your straightforwardness and this totally freaks you out.

"Er...I mean..." you try to correct yourself.

"Adorable in what way?" she asked.

Her body language was the same as before, but her face had changed. You have her full attention.

It was a strange question to consider: On one hand, you think she's adorable in the way that some people view energetic kittens. But you never really viewed her as a non-person. On the other hand, you're a 15 (almost 16) year old guy and you can't held noticing her figure. Dr. Roy was able to find some more clothes that could fit her 5-inch tall body and the cutoff jean shorts and the tank top she was wearing was showing off her great skin. She wasn't fully tanned, but she wasn't even remotely pale. She had curves in all the right places and the combination of her red-hair and her pale blue eyes made her face completely stunning. Her attitude, her looks, her energy, how do you summarize it all?

After a few seconds of thinking you drape your hand over her tiny body like a huge blanket and start stroking her back.

"Adorable in the best kind of way," you finally answer.

She quickly moves her arm to try and cover her face, but you can tell she's blushing. After a minute she asks another question:

"Do you think I'm pretty?"

"You're beautiful," you respond.

"D-d....do you like me?"

"Yeah I do," you answer.

"Would...would you uh...well...," she stuttered.

"What is it, Jess?" You ask.

Jess takes a deep breath and moves her arm away from her face. She looks up at you, but her eyes are closed because she doesn't want to make eye contact.

"Would... would you kiss me?" she finally asked.

After taking a moment to make sure you heard correctly, you wrap your fingers around her tiny body, bringing her into a gentle grip.

"Absolutely," you say with a smile.

You raise her toward her face, but you do your best not to suffocate her with your lips. She reaches her arms up during the kiss and sort of "hugs" your face.

"I like you too big guy," she says after you've finished, with a smile on her face.

That whole exchange could not have gone better. It might be early to say that you have a half-foot tall girlfriend, but you both know your feelings for each other.

"Now," you say as you set her down back on your chest, "time to show you what good movies look like."

You two begin watching the original Star Wars trilogy (not the prequels though).
111331111111221.title: "I was thinking about how adorable you are...."

1113311111112211.content:
After watching the three movies, you looked down at Jess for some kind of reaction. She looks up at you and starts slowly crying.

“Jess? Why are you crying?” you ask her. There wasn’t anything too sad about the movies.

“I...I just love these. The suspense, the action, everything. But I do have a question.”

“Shoot.”

“What built up to these movies? I just feel like there’s something missing” she said, tilting her head slightly.

“Well...I mean there are three other movies that go into that, but...you wouldn’t like them. No one does.” You think to yourself ‘oh god. Please don’t go there.’

“Well I’ll be the judge of that. Let’s watch them” she said determinedly.

“Maybe another time. It’s getting late and I want to eat something.” You would do just about anything to not watch the prequels.

“Fine, but we will watch them. Promise?”

“P...promise.”

You close down the laptop and head to the kitchen, where and make some rice. You carry the bowls over to the table and sit down to eat. The rice want anything special, but it was something to eat. Jess wasn’t amused though.

“This is something’s people actually eat?”

“Yes? Why, is something wrong?”

“Well it’s just so...bland. There’s no taste to it.”

“Trust me, there are plenty of foods that don’t have taste. You’ll get used to it.”

The two of you went back to eating. Jess didn’t enjoy it much but she didn’t complain. Once both of you finished, you put the bowls in the washed and headed to your room.

In your room, you started working on your school work while Jess went on your computer, looking up all sorts of things. Just as you finished the last math problem, Jess called over to you.

“Hey Jake, take a look at this.” You walked over to the bed and laid down next to her. On the screen was a beach. ”Remember that one story we read about those two kids who went to the beach? I want to go to one.”

You knew there weren’t any beaches close to where you lived. You had to break it to Jess. “Well there aren’t any close to here. Maybe one day when we go on vacation.”

“Ah, but that could be forever.”

You were about to say more to Jess when you heard the door to your room open. Standing in the doorway was your dad.

“Hey you two. I’ve got some big news.”

“Big news? Is this about Jess?”

“Yes. We have a court case tomorrow. We arrested your parents Jess and tomorrow they are going on trial. I need to ask you Jess: are you willing to come tomorrow to testify?”

“A trial? Testify? What do you mean?”

“It’s like that one game I showed you the other day, where a person is either found guilty or not guilty.”

“Oh. So you need me as a...oh what is it? Oh, a witness?”

“Yes. It’s up to you though. I know it might be tough seeing them again.”

“No. I want to help bring them to justice, just like in the game.”

“Ok. That means we will have to go in early tomorrow. Both of you get some rest.”

“Ok, see you in the morning.”

“Goodnight.”

As your dad closed the door, you looked over over at Jess. She was curled up in a ball, a waterfall of tears pouring from her eyes. You quickly moved over to her and started softly moving your finger gently over her face, wiping the tears.

“Jess, what’s wrong?”

“What was I thinking?! I can’t see them again! I...I...!” She screamed before passing out in your hands. Quickly you cupped her in your hands and rushed her over to your mom’s room.

“Mom, Jess just passed out!”

“What happened?”

“She got all worked up about tomorrow’s trial. She’s got over-anxious.”

“Ok, give her to me. Grab a piece of cloth and wet it.” You quickly ran to your room and grabbed a spare piece of cloth and put warm water on it, returning it to your mom. She laid the cloth over Jess’ head and laid her on a pillow.

After a little bit, Jess slowly woke up. She started crying again. You gently picked her up and place her on your shoulder, rubbing her back.

“It’s ok Jess. You don’t have to go tomorrow. It will be fine.”

“No, I need to go. I need to get passed this.”

“Are you sure Jess? We don’t want you passing out like that again.”

“I won’t. Norm, let’s get some sleep.”

As your mom went back to bed, you and Jess went back to your room and laid in bed.
1113311111112211.title: The evening goes as planned

11133111111122111.content:
The next morning you and Jess wake up and start getting dressed. You decided it would be best to go to the trial with Jess, in case she needed your support.

Your mom and dad were running all around, getting paperwork together, and double checking everything. This was too important for anything to go wrong.

It was only 6:00am when it was time to go. Everyone got in the car and started heading for the courthouse.

The whole car ride down Jess shivered in your lap, a tear leaving her eyes every now and then. All you could do was rub her softly and sooth her.

Soon, you arrived at the courthouse and everyone entered. You, Jess, and your mom all headed to the courtroom and sat at the prosecution table while your dad headed to briefing. Your mom started talking with the lawyer, going over everything while you sat with Jess, comforting her. She wasn’t crying as much, but she definitely wasn’t fine, only showing how much she needed you right now.

Then Jess’ family came in, sitting at the defense table. Just by looking at them you could tell they were a toxic family. The father was very scruffy, while the mother was very snobbish. They obviously had a hatred for their daughter (If they even thought of her as one) which they put on us for obvious reasons. The whole time they looked at us, making faces.

Finally, after almost two hours, the whole court was alive with voices of curious people and officials. Once everyone was ready, the court came to order. All the legal mumbo jumbo went on and on. Mom and dad talked, and arguments ensued between the two family’s.

Finally, it was time for Jess to take the stand. Getting up from your chair, you carried her over to the stand and placed her on the wooden counter. You were allowed to stay with her as she might require assistance.

On the stand, Jess told her whole life story. The abuse, the torture, everything she went through. The whole time she started weeping and shuddering. All you could do was stand there as she went through a mental breakdown.

Once she finished, you put her on your shoulder and headed out of the courtroom. Neither of you needed to be part of the conflict.

It was now 3:00pm. It had been almost eight hours now and the whole time Jess had either been crying a waterfall or passed out from exhaustion. You had gently held her in your lap, running your finger over her head. Finally, the bang of a gavel could be heard from the room, followed by the combined chatter of everyone inside. A crowd of people started exiting the room, the chatter following them. Then, your mom came out, her face as bright as the sun. As she came over, you looked down to Jess, who was passed out.

“So, what happened? Did you win?”

“Win? Is that even a question? That family had it coming. You wouldn’t even believe some of the worse things they have been convicted for. Besides abuse-“

“I’m sure. So we get to keep Jess?”

“Yes. Your father is current filling out the custody papers as we speak. How is Jess doing?”

“Well if being passed out is anything, then that’s something.”

“Aw. The poor girl must be completely tuckered out. Let’s leave her be. I’m sure she will feel much better once she gets the good news.”

After leaving the courthouse and arriving home, Jess had still now woken up. You took her up to your room and watched over her. Her breathing was slow and light, her body limp. It was worse that anyone had expected. It wasn’t till almost 11:00pm it happened. While working on some schoolwork, you could hear Jess rustling about.

“No...No! I...I can’t go back there! I...I!” She screamed. You quickly rushed over to her, cupping your hands under her.

“Jess! Jess! Wake up! It’s ok.” You gently but firmly shook her, moving you finger along her back. To your relief, she finally awoke. She slowly opened and closed her eyes, taking in her surroundings. She looked up to you, giving a slight smile.

“Oh, hey...Jake. That was some sleep I had.”

“No kidding. You had me worried for a bit.”

“So...what happened?”

“We won Jess. You’re here to stay.” Almost like a cat, Jess popped up to her feet and pounced onto you, giving you a “big” hug.

“Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!”

“Whoa, easy there. You welcome. Welcome to the family. Officially that is.”

“Thank you Jake. Now, maybe we can get to watching the prequels?”

“Jess, it’s 11:00pm. Time for bed.”
11133111111122111.title: The Big Day

what happens next?

11133111111122122.content:
As you regain consciousness you feel your hands are bound and there is something over your head. You soon hear screams coming from up stairs then it all hits you at once your memories what happened at your house. You hear footsteps coming down the stairs you pretend you are still unconscious. The footsteps continue to grow louder and closer, but they stop just in front of you and a little light comes on. The bag is removed from your head it takes a second for your eyes to adjust to the light. You remain silent and still but the person punches you in the nose."Think it's fun to kidnap someone's daughter?", they scolded.

"...", you remained silent.

"ANSWER ME!!", they screamed slamming their hands on the table in front of you. You just looked them in the eye and still said nothing. He yelled to someone up stairs, and the screaming got louder. It sounds like...Jess!

"Alright I will talk just leave her alone.", you said finally.

"I'm afraid I can't do that." he said smiling, "She has to punished for leaving."

"LEAVE HER ALONE!!" you yelled,"Do what you want to mean just leave her alone."

You both set there in silence staring each other in the eye until he yells again and the screaming stops. He snaps and a kid whom is also covered in bruises comes out from the shadows and hands him something. "You know what this is friend?"he asks while starting to pace,"This here is my pride and joy call her slasher."

"How original.", you say mockingly. He brandishes his freshly cleaned hunting knife. He cuts off a bit of you hair probably to show you how sharp it is. "I've always wanted to use this baby on something.', he said twirling it threw the air."You already have pa.", said the boy while flashing a fresh cut on his forearm. Looking at the girl, you could see the confusion and sadness on her face. Gently, you patted her with your hand, rubbing her back with your finger. "Hey, it's ok. Your safe now. I know we both don't understand what happened, but right now at least your safe with me, right?

For a moment, the girl said nothing, but then she...
11211.title: Ellie's Past

112111.content:
From her sorrowful state, she looked up at you and smiled, much to your relief.

“Thank...you. Sorry about freaking out earlier on the table. It’s just that...at my size I feel so...vulnerable.”

“I understand. Look, I know how easy it seems for me to take advantage of you, but...I wouldn’t, not to you. You’re my friend now. I couldn’t do that to a friend.”

You could see Ellie looking at you, seemingly emotionless. I went too far. She definitely doesn’t trust me now you think to yourself.

Finally, she gains her wits

“Tony, while your sentiments make me grateful to have been found by you, thanking you over and over again is getting tiring. But still...thank you.”

Both of you chuckle a little.

After finishing the show, you take Ellie up to your room. It was pretty average: a bed, a desk, and a television. You sit on your bed and place Ellie on you right night table.

“Well, this is my room. It’s nothing special but it’s better than nothing. I doubt you want to sleep with me so you can sleep on my night table. Let me just make something real quick.”

You go over to your desk and pull together some scraps from an arts and crafts bin you have in your room. Despite your age and gender, you still enjoyed making small crafts, and now they were perfect for what you needed.

Grabbing your small creation, you bring it over to the night table.

“I hope this is ok for now. This is all I can make with what I have.”

It’s a little bed, complete with a foam mattress, a cotton pillow, and cover. Ellie looked over it curiously. She jumped on and screamed herself with glee.

“This is perfect! Thank you!”

“I’m glad you like it. Now, time for bed. Sleep well.”

“You too.”
112111.title: Smiled Kindly at You

1121111.content:
It was early in the morning when you woke up. You look over your night table to see the time: 6:30am. Ugh, of course I forgot to set my alarm. Wait...Where's Ellie? You frantically looked around the room from where you are laying.

"Ellie! Ellie!" You called out.

"What! What!" She cried out from your desk.

"Oh there you are. I thought you ran away or something happened. What were you even doing over there...and where did you get that clothing?"

"Well after losing my only outfit yesterday I decided I needed to make myself my own. I appreciate the one you gave me but these fit my style more."

"Oh wow. How did you sew it together though?"

"Lots...Lots of patience. Now, don't we have school today?"

"Oh, right. Let me go get ready."

You drag yourself out of bed and start walking towards the bathroom when you hear Ellie again.

"Hey, can you bring me with you? I need to get ready too." The request took you aback a little

"You do know I need to change right? I don't care if you come along but I don't think you want to see me like that."

"No no no, I wasn't going to watch. I'm not like that."

"Ok, if you insist."

You walk back into the room and pick up Ellie, placing her on your shoulder. You exit your room again and head across the hall to the bathroom. Ellie jumped off and pulled some stuff out of her pockets. You looked closely at them.

"You had time to make a toothbrush and brush as well?"

"Well of course. Can't be unhygienic."

"True. Now let me get my stuff done."

Ellie obliged, turning away to start brushing her teeth. After watching for a second, you climb in the shower and unclothe.

Once you finish, you peek out around the curtain and see Ellie looking the the mirror. You grab a towel and climb out of the shower. She looks away from the mirror.

"Is it ok to look?"

"Yes, I have a towel." She looks back at you and sighs.

You awkwardly try to get dressed and then brush your teeth. After doing so, you pick up Ellie again and run into your room, scooping up your backpack. As you headed toward the door, you thought of something.

"Hey, you're going to need to hide somewhere, aren't you? I'm not quite sure how people are going to take to seeing a 4 inch person on my shoulder."

"Oh, right...I guess I could go in your backpack for now. Let me just jump in." You feel her stand on your shoulder and make her way down to your backpack, pulling the zipper open and climbing in. "Ok, I'm all set I guess. Just try not to bump your bag too much."

"Wouldn't think of it."
1121111.title: The Next Morning

1122.content:
"Oh god, it was all a dream.", I said to myself. I tended to fall asleep in my hot tub. I started to relax and smelled my carrot-shampoo in the ai... WAIT, I didn't have such a thing! But when was the last time I smelled carrots?

"Well, I guess he just wanted to cook me!", I said depressed, "And just when I started to get not scared around him!"

There was no doubt that I would die, expect for the fact, that this 'soup' wasn't hot. And the pot was way to big for a pot (even for a normal sized one). That's when I started to look for the carrot smell.

I realized two things! First, there was a little plate with carrot pieces ON the water and second, and more importantly, this wasn't a soup!

You're awake! I thought you were dead, when I saw your body on the table!"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----
([Oh] boy!)

I saw the girl, not moving. "Great, now I'm responsible for a dead person!", I thought. But then, I saw her breathing! Not much, but at least, she wasn't dead! "I need to help her! But how?"

After a few minutes, it came to me: Water's suppose to help waking someone up!

Quickly, I've turned on the water and waited, till it was so high, that the girl wasn't drowning, but still was almost completely covered. "Now to play the waiting game...", I said, taking a seat in front of the makeshift bathtub.

SEVERAL MINUTES LATER

A movement woke me from my slumber. "I better don't speak to her, right now. I don't want her to fall unconsciousness again.", so I just watched. "Oh god, it was all a dream!" She started to relax at first, but then, she sat up straight before she shrugged her shoulders, as if she accepted a fate. I could only understand one word: cook. "Seriously?", I thought and stared down in disbelief.

The I saw that she noticed the carrots, and thought that this was the right time to talk to her. "Your awake! I thought you were dead, when I saw your body on the table!"

"Don't hurt me!...please.", I begged of the monster that sat over me. A low but loud sound was coming from the beast then I looked at him he was laughing. He reached his hand over me and brought it down atop of me; I was sitting there shivering in a pool of water thinking this was it. He grabbed me in his hand I was starting to tear up thinking this, of all things is how I'm going to die eaten by some monster. He opened his hand and I fell into his palm.

"YOU OK?", he asked with a little smile. I nodded my head slowly.

"GOOD!", he exclaimed. "NOW WE CAN CARRY ON WITH DINNER!", he said. then he paused "PLEASE DON'T FAINT AGAIN.", he said with what sounded like with true concern.

I felt a sudden rush of wind as he set me down on the counter. He went back to chopping the carrots I kept thinking at any moment he would try to chop me. Finding my voice I asked, " Your not going to eat me, are you?" NO! NEVER I TOLD YOU EARLIER THAT I WASN'T GOING TO HURT YOU.", he replied. I met his gaze but only for a moment. " BY THE WAY MY NAME IS TONY.", he said. "A-April" I stuttered.

____________________________________________________________________________ __________________________________________________________________

She said something but I didn't quite hear it, all I knew for sure was that she was terrified. Just the sight of her sitting there in inch deep water made me chuckle. I reached my hand out for her she flinched and curled up into a little ball which made her appear even smaller than she was. When I picked her up I could feel her shaking I brought her closer to my face so I could see her face. She fell into my palm she barley took up any space in it though.

"You okay?", I asked with what I hoped was a comforting smile. She nodded her head slowly.

"Good", I said in reply. "Now we can carry on with dinner.", I said. I stopped recalling what happened earlier "Please don't faint again." I pleaded.

I sat her back down on the counter and began to chop carrots. "Your not going to eat me, are you?", she said fearfully. I turned and looked at her. "No! never I told you earlier that I wouldn't hurt you." I assured her. "By the way my name is Tony.", I said trying to calm her down. "A-April.", she responded.

"Who are you?" she asks, frightened. "Why did you bring me here? What do you want?!"

"Just relax," you tell her. "You fell out of a tree and landed on my shoulder. I thought you might be hurt so I brought you here."

You could tell she was still frightened. She looked up at you, her eyes wide and you could tell she was hyperventilating. She was probably terrified of you.

"I brought you some food," you tell her, pointing to the sandwich next to her.

She walked over to it, broke off a piece of bread and started eating it. "Thank you," she said.

1141.content:
"I'm from another dimension."

"Another dimension?" you reply. "Really?"

She shook her head. "At the time, I was sort of homeless. I came from a broken home and after getting tired of hearing my parents yelling at each other all the time, I just sort of... left."

She tookk another bite of food before continuing. "I wandered around for a few weeks, looking for a job or something, but I was too young at the time. Then one day, a man approached." She frowned at the memory, as if it was unpleasant.

"He was nice to me. Gave me some food. Offered me a job on the spot after I told him about my living conditions. He wouldn't go into detail about it at the time. He only told me that it paid well."

"Next thing I knew," she continued. "I'm being strapped to a gurney, pushed into this whole new world and forced to be someone's pet. I escaped first chance I got. This little girl took me outside to play with her and as soon as she set me down, I ran. I cleared the yard and kept going."

"Anyway, that was over a year ago, I think. Ever since then, I've been on my own."

"Wow," you say after she finished, in awe. "That's amazing."

"So what happens now? Am I supposed to be your pet or something?"

"What?"

"Or do you have plans to sell me to one of your friends?"

"Why would I do that?" you ask her.

"Because it's how your kind is. With me, at least."

"Look..." you struggle to find the right words to say for a moment. "You'd never be my pet. I'd never treat you like that. You're...a person. A tiny person, but still a person."

"And you wouldn't keep me in a cage or anything stupid like that?"

"Not if you didn't want to be," you told her.

"Good, because your kind have treated me like crap since the moment I arrived in this place."

"I..." you look down at her, her tiny arms were crossed over her chest. She was glaring up at you now. She was defiant. Strong. It's probably why she's lasted this long. "Look, I think we've gotten off on the wrong foot. If you want to stay here, that's fine. I'm not going to force you to do anything you don't want to do. Okay?"

"Really?" she asked, sofrening up a little.

"Of course," you continue. "If you don't want to be in a cage, that's fine. If you want to be able to roam free, walk around, that's fine, too. I mean, I still live with my parents, so I don't know how they would feel about you, so maybe just stay in my room for the time being. But it doesn't matter to me what you want to do."

She looks thoughtfully up at you, before replying...

See the thing about Jake is that he is by nature a loner. No one wants him or be near him. To make it easier for you all to understand his parents ditched him at an orphanage when he was a month old, the nuns never make sure he was alright, and he ran away from the orphanage at the age of ten. He found an abandon house and made it his home. Sure he stole gardening tool, seeds and stuff like that but he was able to raise himself. Now for the house it was a normal house probably about a couple of devades ago but now it was a house that had rotten wood, holes in the ceiling, and vermin at every turn in the house. No one wants to live there but Jake makes do of it.

As fir school Jake just lies for almost everything about it. What he tells everyone is that his parents are divorced and only during the fall and winter is when he is in state while spring and summer he lives with his dad in Maine. The truth he only went to school to keep warm and once it got warm enough he ditched and waited for the whole cycle to start over again. While he did this no one even cared enough to look for him, to befriend him, or even talk to him. He was nothing more then a phantom to everyone. He doesn't mind the lonely life because that was what his life was destain to be. Until he found this little girl. Now he had someone/thing to share his pain. To keep him company, to talk to, hell if she cursed him out he could just use her as a toy/slave.

As Jake walked home thinking of what he should do with his new friend/toy/slave only one thing bugged him. What was he going to say to her? Or better yet how would she react?

Jake thought and figured Let her do the that for me. If she flips shit she is my slave, talks down on me = toy, tries to reason with me a friend.

Rose was hoping for it to tip over not to hit the ground because then as the glass turned into shards she would end up dead on impact. "We should leave I don't think it would be good if we stay with the dragon. Once we get the maps we ask for the exit and say our thanks," Robin says slipping out of the glass jar.

"Your right, I don't think we can trust him. I mean where did he get the jars?" Viven asked also sliding out.

"Oh but what about his money?" Nami wined as she followed suit.

"Dragons are creatures of pride if a loved one gave them their horde they'll protect it forever," Robin said.

"Thank you for staying there," the dragon said. "Here are the maps they might be big to you guys but they should be small enough for you three to carry." He handed them the four maps, and he told them the first one was the map of the forest and where his cave was and where they could find some fairies for help with returning to normal size. The other two were maps of nearby towns that they could stay. "And if you need help you know where to find me and/or the fairies." The last one was a map of the world where the three women realized that they were no longer on their planet.

"Thank you for everything you have done for us," Robin said. "But aren't these maps your mother's?"

"Yes they are, but I was hoping that once you have a place to stay you can return the maps to me," the dragon said.

"Well can fairies teleport people to other worlds?" Viven asked.

"Wait your not from her? Oh well that explains a couple of things," the dragon said.

"Like what?" Nami asked.

"You all smell like the the ocean. Your clothing isn't from anywhere around here, lack of knowledge, and a couple of other things," the dragon stopped and thought for a moment. "Well I..." before he finished a spear flew right at the dragon's shoulder hitting it dead on. Holding his breathe the dragon grabbed the three girls and retreated to his treasure room. He left the torch so the women wouldn't find them, nor his attacker know where he was.

"The beast is here!" some man yell. "I'm not sure if Joe hit the beast. Let's find out!"

"What's happening?!" Viven asked shivering out of her skin.

"Dragon hunters," the dragon whispered. "They don't care if we're peaceful creatures or not, they just want us as dragon armor, or to sell our hides."

"That's sick." Viven said.

"It is but their hit bounced off of me. Dragon scales are stronger then any man made weapon, that's why our hides are worth three bags of gold," the dragon said backing up hearing foot steps come closer.

"Looks like the creature ran into one of the tunnels. It would be suicide to try and find it. Let's go."

The dragon waited for a moment or two before moving again. "They're waiting outside of the cave. Best chance is the roof."

"What?" they all ask. Before he gave an answer his wings unfolded and in two seconds they were airborne. Drak keep his hands cupped and put them close to his chest so the cold air wouldn't harm them.

"Sorry, but that is the only way to get out of there other then the front door way," Drak said.

"You could have warned us!" Viven yelled as they flew through the sky.

"Well At least I have the maps. Without them we would be horribly lost. Now," looking at the maps, "the flight should be five minutes." Drak smiled.

"So what's it like," Robin asked.

"To be a halving, both sides make fun of me and most wish to kill me. Other then that it's okay." Drak said.

"Well we have a captain named Luffy that would love to have you on the crew if you want to join," Robin said

"Not sure, dragons took me in and taught me how to speak English, how to fly, breathe flames, everything I know they taught me. And to join a group of humans who I just meet? Sorry but I need to know you better and then I still might not go," said Drak.

"Hehehe I remember how Luffy got me to join," Nami began. "When we first meet I thought he was just another dumb-ass, stole his ship, and in the end he helped me with a problem I had, I still don’t know what I would have done if he didn’t help.” Nami started to cry a little.

“Uh Nami what did Luffy help you with?” Viven asked while rubbing her shoulder.

“Well a fishman named Arlong, he took control of my town, and … and …”Nami started to cry harder. “He killed my mother. I joined his crew to so I could buy the town back but that dirt ass bastard broke the deal and, Luffy beat him all in the name of our friendship,”Nami started to laugh, “In fact he didn’t force me to join, or do anything, I joined and stayed through thick and thin.”

“Oh Nami, I’m sorry,” Viven said. Robin stared at her seeing the kind of hell she was put through.

“This Luffy sounds like a noble man. I wouldn’t mind taking to him some day,” Drak said still flying to the forest.

The three girls started to laugh, Viven said, “Luffy’s not a smart guy, but he knows that if something bugs his friends, he will put an end to it.”

“Oh, is there anyone else on our crew?” Drak asked looking down, making sure he didn’t past the fairies domain.

“Well Luffy’s our captain. Then we have Zoro, our three blades swordsman. Usopp the sniper, Sanji the cook. Chopper our doctor, who is a reindeer. Then we have …

15531.content:
You’re Jake, a fifteen year old boy that loves to hang around with your friends. But sadly because the fact both your parents are travel freaks you can never stay in the same place too long. When you were five you they started their travel businesses. Your dad is one of the lead heads of a famous car industry. He fixes all the problems the company’s machinery has. As for your mom, she is the lead of a help helping other countries. She basically goes from one country to the next, while you dad goes from one side of the country to another. You usually went with your dad, but since they got a divorce when you were eight, you went around the world with both of them. To make friends was rare for you. To see your any of your old friends again was even rarer. Right now you’re staying with your dad as he fixes the machinery in New Jersey. You’ve never been here before, so it’s a new start, for the next two to three months before you go with your mom to Kenya, another place you have never been. Now with the new school you’re going to, no seems to like you so you’re on your own for the most part. As you walk to the hotel on today something hit’s your shoulder.

You looked over and saw a tiny girl on your should, before you got a good look at her, she got up and jumped off your shoulder. It happened so fast that, you weren’t sure what just happened. You keep walking, trying not to look strange, but you also think about what just happened. A tiny girl fell out of a tree, onto your shoulder and then jumped off. You looked back to the tree and saw the drop she had, it looked that she might have feel from a low branch, maybe a foot from your head. If she jumped off it would have been at least a five foot drop, and at her size, that would have hurt. Looking back at the sidewalk, there was no blood or little girl. So what happened to her? You shake your head. Then a cold breeze hit you. Your ears start to freeze a bit; you put up your hood…. Your hood! She must have jumped in your hood, but was she still there? You had a couple of more feet to go before you were at the hotel. Once you get in the elevator you find yourself alone, sort of. You turned your jacket around and looked in the hood to see the tiny girl still there. Once again before you can see her, the elevator stops and it’s your stop.

You sigh on the inside as you fix your hood and walk into your bedroom. You turn your hood around again to see she is still in there. She is now cowering in fear, it seems that she thought she was hidden and you didn’t notice her, until you turned your hood around the first time. You pick her up out of the hood, and you can hear cries. You rub her back and try to calm her down. Looking at her clothing, she has some well sown dress, made of some fabric. She had the basics clothing, but what she had on her back confused you. It was a stick made of a couple of things, maybe a walking stick, or a weapon of some sort?

“What do you want?” she asked you. You were taken back, she could talk?! You’re having a hard time understanding the fact that you have a tiny girl in your hand, let alone for her to be able to talk. Well she does look human. I shouldn’t be surprised if she can speak English. you thought.

“Hi,” you say, and she just gives you a look, which causes you to remember her question. “I want to know why you jumped in my hood.”

She looks at you for a bit, looking a like confused, but she responds, “It was either that or be...” she stopped in order to think of something, “What do you call the things with puffy tails?”

“Squirrels?” you answer, wondering why she would ask that.

“Really, we call them jumpers but okay. I would have been squirrel food if I didn’t jump in your “hood”.” The way she talked seemed to be like she knew what she was talking about, but had different names for some things.

“May I ask what your name is?” you ask her.
15531.title: Jake

info.description:
Okay here's what's happening your walking home from school when when a tiny girl lands on your shoulder.
Characters:

You - The main character. 15 years old. He is not the strongest kid ever but he does what he can to make it by. He is very tall for his age, 6 foot. Not well built but he knows how to fight. He is kind to everyone but when he's angry he is a true monster. You guys can change He age if you wish.

Tiny girl- You guys come up with her name and what she's like. For some reason she can't die. She is any age you wish her to be.

Rules:

You can make it so that anyone shrink but it has to be after you and this girl have a talk about her past. It doesn't have to be a dramatic talk just the fact that she needs to have some communication with him or anyone else before you have people shrink.

Tiny girl can be what ever the reader wishes her to be. Kind and caring to a born fighter. I don't care but you have to be creative when you create her past.

You can be attacked and beaten but not killed. He can be holding on by a thread but he lives. Same rules for the tiny girl.

You can either live allown in a apanden house or with a family in a mansion. Make the family creative.

I will let vore, unbirth, stomped, anything but gore.

Nothing gory. I don't like the whole blood scenes are needed unless you is in a fight with a bother person. Then it's okay.

For unbirth the tiny girl will need to run into Your mom or sister(s) your choice.

And also I want everyone that adds to be creative. [Example, your a dragon the finds them, just be creative.]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sorry but I changed the main character because I got to many angry messages. So I changed the main character's name to stop them.
